subject: Re: TestTest.testSharing() not sharing?

messageBody:
In the meanwhile I did find my glasses and, along with them, the
answer to my question.

For those of us with similar vision problems: the TestTest class has
a switch (suite.oneTestInstancePerTest(false);), which allows one to
use the JUnit's original one instance per test or the improved one
instance per test suite.

Apologies,
Richard

--- In junit@y..., rjansky@c... wrote:
> My apologies to all of you for this likely often-asked question.
>
> I just downloaded Shane Celis' dynamic proxies package with my main
> interest currently being the shared instance variables between
tests
> (for my functional testing using HttpUnit). I then compiled
TestTest
> and ProxyTestSuite using the provided jars and ran TestTest. My
> problem is that I don't seem to be able to get testSharing() to
> share. The initial value of sharing is false. Enter the first round
> of testSharing(), the assertion is confirmed and sharing is set to
> true. Enter the second testSharing(), the value is false again, as
> would be expected with the plain vanilla JUnit.
>
> Can someone point me to the correct path?
>
> Regards,
> Richard
